alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Chambers; Chilton; Clay; Coosa; Randolph; Shelby; Talladega; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 27 at 4:15AM CDT until March 27 at 8:15AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Bibb County in central Alabama... Northern Chilton County in central Alabama... Southern Shelby County in central Alabama... Chambers County in east central Alabama... Southern Clay County in east central Alabama... Coosa County in east central Alabama... Southern Randolph County in east central Alabama... Southwestern Talladega County in east central Alabama... Northern Tallapoosa County in east central Alabama... * Until 815 AM CDT. * At 415 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Alabaster, Alexander City, Sylacauga, Calera, Clanton, Lanett, Montevallo, Roanoke, Brent, Columbiana, Dadeville, Centreville, Jemison, Ashland, Wilsonville, Goodwater, Rockford, Kellyton, Talladega Springs and Stewartville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Bibb; Chambers; Chilton; Clay; Coosa; Randolph; Shelby; Talladega; Tallapoosa
